title: Election Needles: Georgia Senate Runoffs
html_content:
Democrats need to win both runoff races to control the Senate.

Warnock vs. Loeffler

Very likely Warnock

Ossoff vs. Perdue

Pretty likely Ossoff

Warnock vs. Loeffler

Georgia

Very likely Warnock

Est. 95% reported

Margin
est.

Warnock +1.9

Warnock +3 to Warnock +1.1

Ossoff vs. Perdue

Georgia

Pretty likely Ossoff

Est. 95% reported

Ossoff +1.1

Ossoff +1.9 to Ossoff <0.5

The race still seems close but Democrats are overwhelming favorites to prevail, including Jon Ossoff, who still trails David Perdue by a narrow margin. The remaining vote is from heavily Democratic counties.

Win Prob.

Margin. Est.

Est. 95% reported

Very likely Warnock

>95% Warnock

Warnock +1.9

Warnock +3 to Warnock +1.1

How the needle estimates have changed so far:

The table below shows our expectations for results, based on where they came from; the type of vote; and other results already reported. How these expectations compare with reality shifts our estimate of how the state is leaning.

Where votes remain

For precincts that have not yet reported all their votes, we make an estimate based on the results so far, what voting methods are left, and what we know about the people who live in those places.

Estimated votes remaining

Circle size is proportional to the amount each county's leading candidate is ahead.

Counted

Vote type Votes counted Est. pct of all votes Leader
Election day 1,244,272 28% Loeffler +27
Mail-in 995,764 22% Warnock +35
Early vote 2,055,083 46% Warnock +1
Total 4,295,137 96% Warnock +0.8

Remaining (est.)

Vote type Est. votes remaining Est. pct of all votes Est. leader
Election day 70,000 2% Loeffler +8
Mail-in 73,000 2% Warnock +53
Early vote 19,000 0.4% Warnock +82
Total 176,000 4% Warnock +29

We think about 176,000 votes remain. If that's right, Loeffler would need to win about 60 percent of those votes. We think she's on track to win between 25 and 46 percent. (Our best guess is 36 right now)

Last model run: 11:48 PM ET

Warnock vs. Loeffler, margin estimates over time

Once a state has counted all its votes, our estimated margin and the reported margin will match. As a rule, when our estimated margin is steady in the presence of new data, our forecast is more trustworthy.

Est. margin

Best guess

5%

95%

4,295,137 votes counted, est. 180,000 votes remaining.

>95% Ossoff

Where votes remain

For precincts that have not yet reported all their votes, we make an estimate based on the results so far, what voting methods are left, and what we know about the people who live in those places.

Estimated votes remaining

Circle size is proportional to the amount each county's leading candidate is ahead.

Counted

Vote type Votes counted Est. pct of all votes Leader
Election day 1,292,858 29% Perdue +27
Mail-in 1,002,124 22% Ossoff +34
Early vote 2,054,776 46% Ossoff +0.4
Total 4,349,778 97% Perdue <0.1

Remaining (est.)

Vote type Est. votes remaining Est. pct of all votes Est. leader
Election day 20,000 0.4% Perdue +10
Mail-in 67,000 1% Ossoff +56
Early vote 19,000 0.4% Ossoff +81
Total 120,000 3% Ossoff +44

We think about 120,000 votes remain. If that's right, Ossoff would need to win about 51 percent of those votes. We think he's on track to win between 56 and 87 percent. (Our best guess is 72 right now)

   Show Fewer Older Updates          Where votes remain  For precincts that have not yet reported all their votes, we make an estimate based on the results so far, what voting methods are left, and what we know about the people who live in those places.          Estimated votes remaining     Circle size is proportional to the amount each county's leading candidate is ahead.            Counted      Vote type   Votes counted   Est. pct of all votes   Leader       Election day 1,244,272 28% Loeffler +27   Mail-in 995,764 22% Warnock +35   Early vote 2,055,083 46% Warnock +1   Total 4,295,137 96% Warnock +0.8       Remaining (est.)      Vote type   Est. votes remaining   Est. pct of all votes   Est. leader       Election day 70,000 2% Loeffler +8   Mail-in 73,000 2% Warnock +53   Early vote 19,000 0.4% Warnock +82   Total 176,000 4% Warnock +29      We think about 176,000 votes remain.  If that's right, Loeffler would need to win about 60 percent of those votes. We think she's on track to win between 25 and 46 percent. (Our best guess is 36 right now) 
      Last model run: 11:48 PM ET
                 Warnock vs. Loeffler, margin estimates over time  Once a state has counted all its votes, our estimated margin and the reported margin will match. As a rule, when our estimated margin is steady in the presence of new data, our forecast is more trustworthy.    Show Fewer Older Updates          Where votes remain  For precincts that have not yet reported all their votes, we make an estimate based on the results so far, what voting methods are left, and what we know about the people who live in those places.          Estimated votes remaining     Circle size is proportional to the amount each county's leading candidate is ahead.            Counted      Vote type   Votes counted   Est. pct of all votes   Leader       Election day 1,292,858 29% Perdue +27   Mail-in 1,002,124 22% Ossoff +34   Early vote 2,054,776 46% Ossoff +0.4   Total 4,349,778 97% Perdue <0.1       Remaining (est.)      Vote type   Est. votes remaining   Est. pct of all votes   Est. leader       Election day 20,000 0.4% Perdue +10   Mail-in 67,000 1% Ossoff +56   Early vote 19,000 0.4% Ossoff +81   Total 120,000 3% Ossoff +44      We think about 120,000 votes remain.  If that's right, Ossoff would need to win about 51 percent of those votes. We think he's on track to win between 56 and 87 percent. (Our best guess is 72 right now) 
      Last model run: 11:48 PM ET
                 Ossoff vs. Perdue, margin estimates over time  Once a state has counted all its votes, our estimated margin and the reported margin will match. As a rule, when our estimated margin is steady in the presence of new data, our forecast is more trustworthy.
